channel.title: New York
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: Homes that Sold for $450,000 and Under
item.description: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
item.author: Compiled by C.J. HUGHES

item.title: New York Attorney General to Investigate Taser Death of Bronx Man
item.description: The review by the office of Eric T. Schneiderman will include whether Ariel Galarza, who died on Wednesday, was armed when a police officer used an electric stun gun on him.
item.author: By ELI ROSENBERG

item.title: Sergeant Who Was Killed in the Bronx Is Recalled as a Genial Family Man
item.description: Colleagues and neighbors of Sgt. Paul Tuozzolo, who was killed in a gunfight on Friday, expressed their condolences.
item.author: By ALAN FEUER

item.title: Facing Death, Brooklyn District Attorney Spoke of Doing What ‘Is Right’
item.description: In his last interview, Ken Thompson, who died last month at 50, described his proudest accomplishments and a desire to reform “fundamentally unfair” aspects of the criminal justice system.
item.author: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR

item.title: What’s Selling Now in New York Stores
item.description: A sampling of the best sellers that have been flying off shelves and onto New York City streets.
item.author: By JEREMY ALLEN

item.title: New York Police on Alert After Warning of Terror Attack Before Election
item.description: An F.B.I. bulletin said that Al Qaeda might be planning attacks for Monday, but an official said there was skepticism about the credibility of the information.
item.author: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

item.title: Builders That Got Tax Breaks Must Set Aside Some Units for Homeless, City Says
item.description: Moving to reduce the number of New Yorkers in shelters, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration is requiring developers that got 421-a subsidies to give some units to homeless people.
item.author: By CHARLES V. BAGLI

item.title: Yonkers Schools Flouted Rules on Special Education, U.S. Agency Says
item.description: As a result of an investigation, the federal Education Department announced that the city agreed to revamp its procedures.
item.author: By ELIZABETH A. HARRIS

item.title: Federal Investigation of New Jersey Transit Finds Numerous Safety Violations
item.description: At a hearing with state lawmakers, the new leader of the agency, Steven Santoro, called the issues “unacceptable” and pledged improvements.
item.author: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS

item.title: Police Sergeant Fatally Shot in the Bronx; Another Is Injured
item.description: The sergeant who died had been struck in the head, the authorities said, while the other was shot in the leg. The suspect was shot and killed.
item.author: By AL BAKER, ELI ROSENBERG and BENJAMIN MUELLER
